title: Export from Developer Data Sources
description: Guide to exporting and visualizing data from developer data sources using Nomic Atlas.

overview.purpose: Atlas enables users to analyze data from developer sources such as GitHub, Jira, and other project management tools.
key_features: Supports integration with multiple developer tools.
Allows visualization of commit histories, issue tracking, and project metrics.
Facilitates data export for further analysis.

supported_data_sources.description: Extract commit histories, pull requests, and issues for visualization.
Analyze issue tracking data and sprint metrics.
Upload custom datasets in CSV or JSON format for visualization.

steps.description: Connect to the data source using API credentials or export tools provided by the platform.
Format the data as required by Nomic Atlas (CSV, JSON, or embeddings).
Upload the formatted data to Nomic Atlas using the API or web interface.
Visualize the data in Atlas using maps, clusters, or other tools.

endpoints.description: Uploads data to Nomic Atlas for processing and visualization.
Creates a map visualization from the uploaded data.

github.description: Export commit histories from GitHub for visualization.
github.python_code:
import requests

url = 'https://api.github.com/repos/<owner>/<repo>/commits'
headers = {
    'Authorization': 'Bearer <GITHUB_TOKEN>'
}
response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
data = response.json()
print(data)

jira.python_code:
import requests

url = 'https://<jira_instance>.atlassian.net/rest/agile/1.0/board/<board_id>/sprint'
headers = {
    'Authorization': 'Basic <BASE64_ENCODED_CREDENTIALS>'
}
response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
data = response.json()
print(data)

notes: Ensure you have the necessary API credentials for each data source.
Data formatting is critical for successful upload and visualization in Atlas.
Refer to the API documentation for detailed parameter requirements.
